climbs.name: Ticket to Ride
climbs.fa: bolted by Vernon Phinney, Chris Barnes, & Mike Engle, Aug 2018

content.description: Long and fun route.  Start on obvious featured holds just right of a blank orange face.  Make a couple moves to to get established and follow easy good stone to a ledge about half way up the wall. From the ledge, pull onto the face and climb up a right facing dihedral to a steep bulge with a crack on the right.  Stem up and over the bulge using the crack on the right and occassional holds on the left.  Very engaging from the ledge to the anchors.  Full length pitch.
content.protection: 15 bolts and sport anchors.  You can just make it to the ground lowering from the sport anchors with a 60 meter rope.  For this one, tie knots in the end of your ropes!
content.location: Start about 10 feet to right of the prominent dihedral of Come Together.  Climb towards a obvious dihedral and crack on the upper headwall.

climbs.name: Take a Walk on the Wild Side
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; 2019

content.description: Thin, tricky section down low, lead to a fun chert knob romp to the anchors.
content.protection: About 8 bolts, sport anchors.  Can lower with a 60 meter rope.
content.location: Just uphill from the right edge of Wonderwall is small crag.  This the only route on this portion of the cliff.  About 150 feet uphill from AC/DC.

climbs.name: Stone Free
climbs.fa: bolted by Vernon Phinney, Chris Barnes, & Mike Engle, Aug 2018

content.description:
P1:  Start with a move over a prow close to ground and follow much easier terrain to a large ledge and chain anchors.  Pleasant easy climbing but nothing special.

P2:  This is an amazing pitch.  From the chain anchors on pitch 1 follow a steeo band of "C" shaped chert holds.  Good hand holds but poor feet.  Pumpy and super fun all the way to the anchors.

With a little rope management and long draws at the top of P1 it is possible to climb the route as one long 100' pitch (as was done on the FFA).
content.protection: If done as a single pitch, 15 draws and sport anchors at the top.  You can lower to ground with a 60 meter rope - barely.  Knot the ends of your rope!
content.location: Start left of a large grey 30' pillar and climb towards a ledge below a "C" shaped chert band.

climbs.name: Rubber Soul
climbs.fa: bolted by Vernon Phinney, Chris Barnes, & Mike Engle, Sept 2018

content.description: Start on a broad face with a thin horizontal about 8 feet off the deck.  Work the edge and get stood up and gain a jug about another 6 feet up.  Continue up techinical grey limestone on small holds until you reach a very thin scoop.  Make a couple thin moves to an obvious jug.  Continue up easier rock to the anchors.
content.location: Start 10 feet right of Just What I Needed.  Look for the Rubber Soul name tag on the first bolt.  Shares the sport anchor with Emotional Rescue to the right.

content.description: Climb up the right side of the cleft between Stone Temple & Wonderwall avoiding potential rockfall from gully above.
content.location: South side of Wonderwall, right side of the cleft between Stone Temple & Wonderwall.

climbs.name: Just What I Needed
climbs.fa: Parker Webb & Kira Engle, Sept 2018; bolted by Vernon Phinney, Chris Barnes, & Mike Engle, Sept 2018

content.description: This is a thin and techy slab climb on very good grey limestone.  This route is slightly a squeeze job especially near the top but before the route is confounded with the climbs on either side you reach the anchors.
content.location: Second route on the left side of the prominent grey limestone slab on Wonderwall.  Starts on a small ledge where a large flake used to be.  At the start work right to left to gain the second bolt and follow a natural line to the anchors.

climbs.name: Hey You
climbs.fa: Kira Engle & Parker Webb, Sept 2018; bolted by Vernon Phinney, Chris Barnes & Mike Engle, Aug 2018

content.description: Climb the left side of a grey slab.  Excellent quality rock.  Finish on a short steep chert headwall.
content.location: Leftmost route on the obvious grey slab on the left side of Wonderwall.  Start about 15 feet to the right of a debris field below the gully between Stone Temple and Wonderwall.

climbs.name: Emotional Rescue
climbs.fa: bolted by Vernon Phinney, Chris Barnes, & Mike Engle, Aug 2018

content.description: Start on a weakness than leads to a right trending rail.  Work your hands then feet up the rail and onto the technical grey slab.  Continue more or less straight up to the anchors.
content.location: 8 feet to right of Rubber Soul.  First bolt has a name tag.  Shares anchors with Rubber Soul.

climbs.name: Come Together
climbs.fa: Linda Engle, Sept 2018; bolted by Vernon Phinney, Chris Barnes, & Mike Engle, Aug 2018

content.description: Start in a very obvious shallow right facing dihedral.  Climb to the top of the dihedral and make thin move to gain a small ledge.  Continue up on easy but fun climbing to the anchors.
content.location: Climb the obvious dihedral right of Be Here Now.

climbs.name: Come As You Are
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle, 2019

content.description: Start up hill from Stone Free.  First 20 feet is easy climbing on lichen covered holds.  From a comfortable stance move up through a small bulge and continue up a left trending, left facing open book and at the top make a move left to the anchors.
content.protection: About 10 bolts and a sport anchor.  Lower easily with a single 60 meter rope.
content.location: Next route uphill and to the right of Stone Free.

climbs.name: Be Here Now
climbs.fa: bolted by Vernon Phinney, Chris Barnes, & Mike Engle, Aug 2018

content.description: Short but engaging route.  Climb in from the right to an obvious chert jug about 9 feet off the ground.  Continue on technical thin crimps and pinches working up and slightly to the left.  Route ends when the hard climbing ends.
content.location: Climb the middle of the short steep face between Emotional Rescue and Come Together.

content.description: Starts on a grey face, underneath a large hueco. Climb the face, take a bomber no hands in the hueco, then fire the thin tips seam to the left of the hueco. This one turns on quick and doesn't let up til you're at the chains.
content.protection: 9-10 bolts, sport anchors at the top
content.location: Look for the large hueco on the right side of the wall up the hill, AC/DC starts under and a little to the left of this hueco.
